availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert W. Hilburn (Allen County, Kentucky, farmhand, soldier (C.S.A.), and guerilla)

body.p: Allen County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Mississippi native. Married to Elizabeth H. Mayhew Hilburn in Allen County, Kentucky, on August 12, 1863. Father of Jennette C. Hilburn. Farmhand in Allen County, Kentucky, in 1860. Attended school in Allen County in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Allen County in 1860. Served in the 20th Tennessee Volunteer Infantry (C.S.A.) as a corporal from June 1, 1861, to February 15, 1862. Served in the 19th Tennessee (Biffle's) Volunteer Cavalry (C.S.A.) from February 15, 1862. Served as a private in the 1st Tennessee Volunteer Cavalry Regiment. Paroled at Gallatin County, Tennessee, on May 9, 1865. Reported as a guerilla of Ellis Harper's Partisan Rangers through October 1865. Indicted for robbery in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1865.
